title: Revert is slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: Revert operation in the Java editor is much slower compared to the close and reopen operation.
OB: When I answer "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog, and then double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the file is reopened without any delay. However, if I repeat the above steps and then select "Revert" from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original content.
SR:
1. Open a Java file in the editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. When prompted with the "do you want to save changes" dialog, select "no".
4. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
5. Observe that the file is reopened without any delay.
6. Repeat steps 1-4.
7. From the editor's pop-up menu, select "Revert".
8. Observe that it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original content.
